Parent Organisation Code: Clinical Commissioning Groups
name: general-dental-practices
title: General Dental Practices
notes:
General Dental Practices in England, Wales and Isle of Man 

Contains: 

Name and address information and identifying codes for General Dental Practices in England, Wales and Isle of Man. 

Practices are provided with a parental link to the CCG that is responsible for their operation. This is detailed in the Parent Organisation Code - field 15. It is possible that a relationship might exist outside of the strict geographic boundaries.

codelist: GDC Code: The Practitioners General Dental Council Code
name: general-dental-practicioners
title: General Dental Practicioners
notes:
General Dental Practitioners in England, Wales and Isle of Man 

Contains: 

Name and identifying code for General Dental Practitioners working in England, Wales and the Isle of Man. 

Note that the NHS Dental Services code dental practitioners in a different way from how the NHS Prescription Service code GPs. Instead of allocating multiple codes to each Dentist, one for each of the practices in which they work, each Dentist is given just the one, unique code. 

Dentists do, however, frequently work within multiple practices. In order to avoid duplicate entries within the practitioner file, address information and links to practice are not provided; instead these need to be obtained from the mapping file supplied separately.

codelist: Practicioner Code: General Dental Practicioners

title: General Dental Practicioners - by Practice
notes:
General Dental Practitioner’s membership of General Dental Practices 

Contains: 

A mapping of General Dental Practitioner codes to the Dental Practice or Practices at which they work.

name: care-home-hq
title: Care Home HQ
notes:
Care Home Headquarters 

Contains: 

Care Home HQ data. A standard across ODS data is to maintain a parent-child structure between organisations and their sites, building up a picture of the organisational hierarchy of the NHS. In the ‘Care Homes’ files, field 15 identifies the owning organisation of each individual Care Home 

organisation - in other words, their ‘corporate parent’. In the case of single site organisations, where the one location effectively takes on the role of owning organisation or ‘HQ’ and that of an operating site, the entity will be represented within both files.

codelist: Parent Organisation Code: Care Home HQ
name: care-home-sites
title: Care Home Sites
notes:
Care Home Sites 

Contains: 

Care Home site data. In the ‘Care Homes’ files, field 15 identifies the owning organisation of each individual Care Home organisation - in other words, their ‘corporate parent’. In the case of single site organisations, where the one location effectively takes on the role of owning organisation or ‘HQ’ and 

that of an operating site, the entity will be represented within both files.

name: nhs-trusts
title: NHS Trusts
notes:
NHS Trusts 

Contains: 

Etr.csv contains parent NHS Trusts. All three NHS Trust files follow the same format and conventions, although fields 14 and 15 are only populated for NHS Trust Site records (thus found only in the ets file). This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed 

in the current or previous financial year. NHS Trusts exist in England and Wales.

notes:
NHS Care Trusts 

Contains: 

Care Trust data - Ect.csv contains only the parent organisations. All three Care Trust files follow the same format and conventions, although field 14 is only populated for parent codes (thus not found in the ectsite file) and field 15 is only populated for site codes (thus not found in the ect file). This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year. Care Trusts only exist in England.

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
High Level Health Geography: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
name: independent-sector-healthcare-providers
title: Independent Sector Healthcare Providers
notes:
Independent Sector Healthcare Providers 

Contains: 

Ephp.csv contains parent Independent Sector Healthcare Providers (ISHPs).  Note that ISHPs are considered slightly different from those organisations represented in the Non-NHS Organisations file (enonnhs.csv), in that they are confined to the large private sector healthcare companies which are contracted by the NHS, e.g. BUPA or Nuffield for. The other Non-NHS file is used for smaller private concerns which may take the odd GP referral, such as hypnotherapists.

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
High Level Health Geography: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
Parent Organisation Code: Independent Sector Healthcare Providers
name: independent-sector-healthcare-provider-sites
title: Independent Sector Healthcare Provider SItes
notes:
Independent Sector Healthcare Provider Sites 

Contains: 

Ephp.csv contains parent Independent Sector Healthcare Provider Sites (ISHPs).  Note that ISHPs are considered slightly different from those organisations represented in the Non-NHS Organisations file (enonnhs.csv), in that they are confined to the large private sector healthcare companies which are contracted by the NHS, e.g. BUPA or Nuffield for. The other Non-NHS file is used for smaller private concerns which may take the odd GP referral, such as hypnotherapists.

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
High Level Health Geography: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
name: treatment-centres
title: Treatment Centres
notes:
Treatment Centres 

Contains: 

NHS Trust Sites and Independent Sector Healthcare Provider Sites are able to have a classification or ‘Subtype’ added to them which denotes that they are Treatment Centres. The etreat.csv file publishes those NHS Trust Sites and ISHP Sites that hold this Subtype, together in the one file. This 

is in addition to them appearing in their own dedicated file (e.g. ets.csv and ephpsite.csv).

codelist: GMC Code
Speciality Function Code: NHS Data Model & Dictionary
Location Organisation Code: NHS Trusts/Care Trusts
name: hospital-consultants
title: Hospital Consultants
notes:
Hospital Consultants in England 

Contains: 

Name and identifying codes for Hospital Consultants employed by NHS Trusts in England. The codes are derived from the Practitioner’s General Medical Council code (GMC code), to which a ‘C’ prefix is added.

codelist: GDC Code
Speciality Function Code: NHS Data Model & Dictionary
Location Organisation Code: NHS Trusts/Care Trusts
name: dental-consultants
title: Dental Consultants
notes:
Dental Consultants in England 

Contains: 

Name and identifying codes for Dental Consultants employed by NHS Trusts in England. The codes are derived from the Practitioner’s General Dental Council code (GDC code), to which a ‘CD’ prefix is added. GDC numbers can vary in length from 3 to 6 characters, so in order to maintain a standard 

length of 8 characters (the same as medical consultant codes) filling zeros are used between the prefix and the GDC number, where required. 

Many consultants working in a dental specialty are also qualified doctors, and therefore have a GMC number in addition to their GDC number. In these cases, the consultants are allocated a Consultant Code (derived from their GMC number) and are therefore included in the consultant file econcur.csv 

or wconcur.csv (see above). Sometimes this is in addition to an entry in edconcur.csv; sometimes the practitioners will only have a record in econcur.csv or wconcur.csv. 

There are some dental consultants however, who do not have a GMC number. They are qualified purely in their dental specialty and only have a GDC number. These consultants are included in edconcur.csv only.

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
name: commissioning-regions-area-teams-government-office-regions
title: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
notes:
PAN SHAs, IT Clusters, Government Office Regions, Strategic Health Authorities, NHS England Commissioning Regions and NHS England Area Teams 

Contains: 

Codes for: PAN SHAs, IT Clusters, NHS England Commissioning Regions, Strategic Health Authorities and NHS England Area Teams in England, plus codes for Government Office Regions in England and Wales. It also lists a number of high-level Welsh organisations. This data is for current 

organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year.

Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCG)

Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) Sites 

Contains:

name: commissioning-support-units
title: Commissioning Support Units
notes:
Commissioning Support Units (CSU) 

Contains: 

Ecsu.csv contains parent CSUs and Data Management and Integration Centres (DMIC). 

DMICs will collate commissioning intelligence pertaining to a number of CCGs, and provide this to other elements of the health service infrastructure including other CSUs. The structure of DMICs is varied; some are hosted by a subset of the CSUs, others are stand-alone organisations.

codelist: Parent Organisation Code: Commissioning Support Units
name: commissioning-support-unit-sites
title: Commissioning Support Unit Sites
notes:
Commissioning Support Unit (CSU) Sites 

Contains: 

Ecsusite.csv contains just CSU sites. This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year.

name: special-health-authorities
title: Special Health Authorities
notes:
Special Health Authorities 

Contains: 

Codes for Special Health Authorities in England (note that Special HAs tend to be national organisations rather than administering a particular area of the country). This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year.

codelist: Parent Organisation Code: Special Health Authorities
name: special-health-authority-sites-and-other-statutory-authorities
title: Special Health Authority Sites and Other Statutory Authorities
notes:
Several different organisation types which either did not warrant their own dedicated file at the point of creation, or did not easily fit within an existing file. 

Contains: 

Codes for: Local Service Providers (LSP), LSP Sites, Cancer Networks, Strategic Health Authority Sites (closed), Special Health Authority sites (see espha.csv for parent organisations), Other Statutory Authorities (OSA), OSA Sites, Executive Agencies of the Department of Health, Executive 

Agency Programmes, Executive Agency Programme Departments, Executive Agency Sites, Government Departments, Government Department Sites, Public Health Observatories, Cancer Registries, Channel Island Health Organisations, Military Hospitals, Clinical Networks, Application Service Providers, National Application Service Providers (NASP), NHS England Area Team Sites.

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
High Level Health Geography: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
name: nhs-support-agencies
title: NHS Support Agencies
notes:
NHS Support Agencies and Shared Services 

Contains: 

NHS Support Agencies in England: including current organisations and data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year. These take the form of ‘Shared Services’ and ‘Health Informatics Services’, which are formed when two or more organisations that work closely 

together geographically and operationally, decide to centralise and merge common services (such as Human Resources, IT or Finance Departments).

codelist: National Grouping: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
High Level Health Geography: Commissioning Regions, Area Teams, Government Office Regions
name: hospices
title: Hospices
notes:
Hospices in England, Wales, Isle of Man and the Channel Islands 

Contains: 

Two organisation types, NHS Trust and Non-NHS Organisation, are able to have a classification or ‘Subtype’ added to them which denotes that they offer Hospice Services. The ehospice.csv file publishes those NHS Trusts and Non-NHS Organisations that hold this Subtype together in the one 

file. This is in addition to them appearing in their own dedicated file (e.g. etrust.csv and enonnhs.csv). 

The file contains data for organisations in England, Wales, Isle of Man and the Channel Islands and is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year.

name: pathology-laboraties
title: Pathology Laboraties
notes:
Pathology Laboratories 

Contains: 

Pathology Laboratory data. This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year, based in England. Pathology Labs are based within NHS Trusts so a link to a Trust is provided against each record in the file

name: deaneries
title: Deaneries
notes:
Education Establishments 

Contains: 

Code for Education establishments responsible for leading planning and education commissioning, ensuring the security of supply of the local health and care workforce and supporting national workforce priorities set by Health Education England. Previously this was lead by organisations 

called Deaneries but these organisations were replaced by Local Education and Training Boards in 2013. This data is for current organisations, plus data for organisations that have closed in the current or previous financial year.
